intro: Besleria calycina, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a tropical flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with broad, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and indoor cultivation.
